grith.jgrith.control
Class DirectMyProxyUpload

java.lang.Object
  grith.jgrith.control.DirectMyProxyUpload

public class DirectMyProxyUpload
extends Object

This class provides one-stop methods to create/upload a proxy to a MyProxy server.

Author:
Markus Binsteiner

DirectMyProxyUpload

public DirectMyProxyUpload()
Method Detail

init

public static Map<String,char[]> init(char[] privateKeyPassphrase,
                                      String myProxyServer,
                                      int myProxyPort,
                                      String myProxyUsername,
                                      char[] myProxyPassphrase,
                                      String proxyname,
                                      String renewer,
                                      String retriever,
                                      String description,
                                      int lifetime_in_seconds)
Call this method if you want to upload a proxy directly to a MyProxy server. If you don't specify a MyProxy username the dn of the certificate is used. If you don't specify a MyProxy password a random one is created. There is a lot that can go wrong in this process so be sure to catch a RuntimeException if you call this method.

Parameters:
privateKeyPassphrase - the passphrase of the local private key of the user (in $HOME/.globus/userkey.pem) or null if there is already a local proxy on the machine
myProxyServer - the hostname of the MyProxy server
myProxyPort - the port of the MyProxy server
myProxyUsername - the username of the proxy to create or null (the dn of the credential is used in this case)
myProxyPassphrase - the passphrase to secure the proxy on the MyProxy server or null (a random passphrase is created in that case)
proxyname - the name of the proxy on the MyProxy server (optional, use null if you don't want to specify one)
renewer - the renewer policy (optional, use "*" or null for anonymous)
retriever - the retriever policy (optional, use "*" or null for anonymous)
description - the description of the proxy (optional)
lifetime_in_seconds - the lifetime in seconds
Returns:
a Map which contains the MyProxy username as key and the password as value

init

Call this method if you want to upload a proxy directly to a MyProxy server. If you don't specify a MyProxy username the dn of the certificate is used. If you don't specify a MyProxy password a random one is created. There is a lot that can go wrong in this process so be sure to catch a RuntimeException if you call this method.

Parameters:
proxy - the credential
myProxyServer - the hostname of the MyProxy server
myProxyPort - the port of the MyProxy server
myProxyUsername - the username of the proxy to create or null (the dn of the credential is used in this case)
myProxyPassphrase - the passphrase to secure the proxy on the MyProxy server or null (a random passphrase is created in that case)
proxyname - the name of the proxy on the MyProxy server (optional, use null if you don't want to specify one)
renewer - the renewer policy (optional, use "*" or null for anonymous)
retriever - the retriever policy (optional, use "*" or null for anonymous)
description - the description of the proxy (optional)
lifetime_in_seconds - the lifetime in seconds

init

public static Map<String,char[]> init(GSSCredential proxy,
                                      String myProxyServer,
                                      int myProxyPort,
                                      String myProxyUsername,
                                      char[] myProxyPassphrase,
                                      String proxyname,
                                      String renewer,
                                      String retriever,
                                      String description,
                                      int lifetime_in_seconds,
                                      boolean createUniqueMyProxyUsername)
Call this method if you want to upload a proxy directly to a MyProxy server. If you don't specify a MyProxy username the dn of the certificate is used. If you don't specify a MyProxy password a random one is created. There is a lot that can go wrong in this process so be sure to catch a RuntimeException if you call this method.

Parameters:
proxy - the credential
myProxyServer - the hostname of the MyProxy server
myProxyPort - the port of the MyProxy server
myProxyUsername - the username of the proxy to create or null (the dn of the credential is used in this case)
myProxyPassphrase - the passphrase to secure the proxy on the MyProxy server or null (a random passphrase is created in that case)
proxyname - the name of the proxy on the MyProxy server (optional, use null if you don't want to specify one)
renewer - the renewer policy (optional, use "*" or null for anonymous)
retriever - the retriever policy (optional, use "*" or null for anonymous)
description - the description of the proxy (optional)
lifetime_in_seconds - the lifetime in seconds
createUniqueMyProxyUsername - if you set this to true a timestamp will be appended to your myproxy username
Returns:
a Map which contains the MyProxy username as key and the password as value
